characters: WE PUSH IN ON THE LIST OF BOOKS
WE PULL OUT ON THE LIST OF BOOKS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another picture perfect day in San Diego. The beache golf courses, and yacht clubs are packed with hundreds of rapturous citizens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUS pulls up and unloads it's passengers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow ADAM SCHWARTZ(25), a kind faced, mild mannered, pragmatist - who despite his youth has the cynicism of an man. He steps off the bus, crosses the street and approac MOUNT SINAI HOSPITAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters the Hospital. The mood is calm. All the chaos would expect to find in a hospital of this size is tucked away behind the sterile and monochrome walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks to the reception counter. The RECEPTIONIST is engrossed with the latest edition of US Weekly. She ignor Adam who just stands there awkwardly, unsure of what to d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam gives out a small cough to grab her attention. The Receptionist keeps her eyes fixed on her magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist says nothing. Adam stands silent, not knowing what to do. He coughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, the Receptionist looks up but says nothing. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, am I supposed to go somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her eyes the Receptionist points to the waiting area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, should I go sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist rolls her eyes and returns to her magazi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks around the empty waiting room. He takes a seat browses through a dozen outdated magazines: Highlights, T Life, Modern Maternity, etc. Only moments later, as thoug hadn't just introduced himself, the Receptionist calls ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks around the waiting room. There's no one else there. Again the receptionist calls out again -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist leads Adam to a small changing room and hands him a hospital gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need to take off all my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist stares blankly at Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Receptionist leaves. Adam awkwardly undresses and sli on the hospital gown. Unsure which end of the gown is the front, Adam adjusts the garment a few times until he deci he has it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam pulls back the curtain of the changing room to find JOANNE, an overly cheery nurse. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Adam, my name is Joanne, so nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam scratches his chest, the hospital gown is beginning irritate his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't happen to have anything in a cotton blend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cotton. You're funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne hands Adam a giant specimen cup marked with a thic yellow line.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE JOANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I'm going to need you to fill this cup with urine. You think you can do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to fill this entire cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks down at the cup in total disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna take me at least a week to fill this. Can I take it home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it home. You're so funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS to reveal a group of MEDICAL STUDENTS tak diligent notes in the background. WE PAN AGAIN this time the next room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam struggles to fill the cup. After a few beats, there' knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay in there Adam? 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just another minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks down at the empty cup in frustration. The CAME PANS to the next room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands in front of an X-Ray machine. The APATHETIC TECHNICIAN has him stand in a dozen uncomfortable positio for long periods of time: sideways, one arm in the air, t the other arm, on one leg, then the other, one leg in the air, then the other, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we see the group of Medical Students taking notes. CAMERA PANS to the next room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne pulls out a giant needle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the choo-choo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the back we see the Med Students still taking notes. T CAMERA PANS to the next room:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is lying on the gurney of an MRI machine. He is slow drawn into the enclosed body scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now make sure you lie completely still. Otherwise we'll have to do it all over again. Which we're not going to have to do, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lies perfectly still in the enclosed body scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Is anybody out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no one there. He's been left unattended. The MRI Technician is watching the Laker game in the next room. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Med Students continue to take notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window of the hospital the CAMERA PULLS OUT a PANS across the San Diego skyline. We watch as the Sun se to night, then rises to morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gray morning as the thick spring fog slowly begins lift. With no one in sight, the only sound that can be he is that of the waves crashing onto the shoreline and then rolling back out to the Pacific Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About a mile inland, we come upon:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of identical two and three bedroom town houses with lawns groomed to perfection fill the community. This is Southern California Suburbia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the waves crashing gets increasingly louder louder as we PUSH IN ON:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of Adam's house is spotless. Pictures on the walls: Adam and his dad sailing. Adam and his parents at Bar Mitzvah. Adam and his best friend, Seth, at High Scho Graduation. A University of Berkeley hat. A National Acad Achievement Award in the Sciences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curled in a fetal position, Adam sleeps peacefully next t RACHEL (25), his loving girlfriend. Cute, charming, and artsy, Rachel is "Winnie Cooper" all grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the waves crashing stops abruptly. A loud obnoxious alarm clock goes off. Startled, Adam jumps up. Drenched in sweat, and completely disoriented, he looks around in confusion. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Adam pulls an earplug out of each ear, an turns off the alarm. The sound of the crashing waves turn back on. Adam pushes a button on the alarm clock and the sound of the waves stops, but the loud obnoxious alarm returns. He pushes the clock again. The alarm turns off b now we hear the sound of crickets chirping. Again Adam pu a button, this time we hear the sound of a loud thunder/r storm, he pushes a button again, this time we hear the so of loud clanging church bells. Rachel rolls over -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (asleep and incoherent) Make it stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't turn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Adam tries pushing all the buttons. This only makes it worse. We hear ALL of the previous sounds simultaneously sound off. Rachel rolls over and moans as puts a pillow over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam reaches down and unplugs the alarm clock, bringing a end to the noise. He sits for a moment at the edge of the bed, collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks down at Rachel and begins kissing her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel gently strokes her fingers through Adam's hair. Something catches her attention - a single strand of hair She holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you have a gray hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pull it out. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Don't touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam jumps from bed. He rushes into the bathroom. Rachel rolls back to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands in front of the mirror and searches for the g hair. Once he finds it, he holds it out for a closer look is in fact a gray hair. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Adam showers, he tries to squirt shampoo into his hand but the bottle is empty. He looks over at Rachel's large assortment of shower products, finds one that smells pleasant, Fructis by L'Oreal, and squirts some into his h He then proceeds to lather his entire body in the product

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam dresses in front of the bathroom mirror. His outfit well put together, but not what you would expect of someo his age - more of a Mr. Rogers look. He pulls out a LINT BRUSH and meticulously combs his cardigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SETH (25), pulls up in front of Adam's house in his white Neon and HONKS the horn. On the bumper is a sticker: "Let put the Christ back in Christmas."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overweight, well dressed, and wearing an air of confidenc Seth pulls out a massive joint, lights it and takes a hit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Seth looks over at 3 YOUNG SCHOOL CHILDREN and their MOTHER waiting for the school bus. The mother's jaw on the ground in shock. Seth hides the joint and smiles i embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi kids. Beautiful day isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mother quickly moves her kids out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam approaches Seth's car. He spots his neighbors ANDREW MISSY DONNELLY (late 40's) getting into their car. They w to Adam. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Andrew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the noise last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam shrugs as if to say "what the fuck?" Andrew and Miss giggle as they get into their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam gets into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing perfume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you smell like the cast of Steel Magnolias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran out of shampoo. I had to use Rachel's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a second there I thought maybe you'd fucked Olympia Dukakis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam tries to close his window. The child safety lock is

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you unlock my window? There's a lot of pollen in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth ignores Adam and turns up the music. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, my allergies are flaring up. It feels like my nasal cavities are on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam begins to clear his throat, Seth turns the music eve louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry music's too loud, it's making it hard for me to hear your whining.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the morning bustle as BUSINESS MEN and WOMEN stand line waiting for their morning coffee. Adam and Seth stan the end of that line watching the YOUNG COUPLE in front o them who can't keep their hands off of each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, that guy is clearly a total douchebag...He's wearing Capris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and I used to be like that; like two wild animals in heat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it is only natural though, as we get older, more mature, things begin to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex every three weeks is normal? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't had sex in three weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think maybe she's mad cause I haven't asked her to move in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? I don't think she's waiting for you to ask anything. You're using her shampoo. Next thing you'll be using her tampons. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth laughs at his own joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But seriously, let me get this straight - she has her own place, yet she spends every night with you, in your bed, but she won't sleep with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when does it become a big deal? Five weeks? Six weeks? A year? My cut off...4 days. That's when I begin to worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize how lucky I am to be with Rachel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look around, there are like a million Rachel's in this city alone...well, she's kind of hot, so maybe half a million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're not Rachel. I don't know how to explain it, but being with her just feels right. And I'm not going to overlook that just cause we're in a lull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are in a lull, which is what happens after 35 years of marriage. You've only been dating her four months. At our age sex is all we have. Every time she refuses to sleep with you a small piece of every man's soul dies. She's killing us Adam...You're a semi- smart, semi-successful, semi- average looking dude. Just based on that you could get with at least one third of the female population.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Seth step up to the counter. They're greeted by SUPER GAY BARISTA, who loves his job way too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning gentlemen. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you sleep with my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No just in general.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barista yells to DEMETRI, the other Barista.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Demetri,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demetri examines Adam. He's not impressed with what he se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd let you blow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this is what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barista hands Seth and Adam two cups of coffee, they leave a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Seth enter the museum. They pass JENNY (30) at t information desk.

dialogues.speaker: SETH AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Good morning Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny ignores them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHIL (60), the museum's vivacious director approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salutations gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil sniffs the air and looks at Adam. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing perfume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Rachel's shampoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil goes in for a closer sniff. Then an even closer snif Adam looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fructis by L'oreal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife uses that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth's eyes open wide as Phil goes in for a sniff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, mothballs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth spots a GROUP OF SECOND GRADERS with their TEACHER assembled by the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like my group is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth slaps on a button that reads "DOCENT" and rushes off greet the students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you guys later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil turns to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the Origins exhibit coming along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost done with Upper Paleolithic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm counting on you not to screw up. (looks into Adam's eyes) You're the only one I can trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board is talking about bringing in sponsors...We're a dying art Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil stares into Adam's eyes for what feels like an etern It's incredibly awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil looks at the clock - 10 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna go to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil wanders off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and GREG (45), Adam's slightly moronic co-worker, pl the finishing touches on the CRO MAGNON exhibit - it's an elaborate life sized diorama depicting the life of a fami of four Cro Magnons. Outside their hut it's snowing, but inside there's a large fire and decorative horse drawings the walls. The MAN instructs his SON to paint as the WOMA teaches her DAUGHTER to sew. We see Greg positioning the fossil of a VELOCIRAPTOR next to the mother and daughter. dinosaur looks poised to pounce. Adam notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a velociraptor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinosaur exhibit. (off Adam's look) Why can't we just say it was the first domesticated pet?...People love dinosaurs. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam cringes in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg you can't just...that's a 75 million year old fossil...just please, put it away before someone sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg reluctantly goes to put the dinosaur away. He flaps dinosaur's arm in the air - waving goodbye to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth leads his tour of second graders. He speaks like a t guide at Universal Studios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming up here on our left is the "Origins of Man" exhibit on loan from the Smithsonian Institute. It won't be open to the public for a few more months, so you're one of the first groups to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks up. He hates this part of his job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone this is Adam, he's the curator of ancient civilizations here at the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam gives a reluctant wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell us what we're looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This here is a family of homo sapiens who lived in Europe about 25,000 year's ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In excitement, the kids move in for a closer look. Unaffected, the teacher stays back and files her nails. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...these Cro Magnon's as they're often called, are the closest in the evolutionary chain to modern day humans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KID 1 touches the Cro Magnon father. Still talking, Adam steps in and moves Kid 1's hand off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What made Cro Magnon so advanced was their sense of community...they were the first to settle on a single plot of land, devote to one partner, raise a family, and take care of the sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is lame! I thought you said we were gonna see dinosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage control. Seth points to a life sized NEANDERTHAL M holding a spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to hear about the caveman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth picks up the spear and pretends to charge Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caveman. RRRRRR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, Adam takes the spear out of Seth's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Homo Neanderthalensis - the Neanderthal Man. For over 150,000 years his ancestors dominated all of Europe. But then about 30,000 years ago, Neanderthals began to disappear, until one day, their entire civilization was gone. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg you know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Tell us what happened to the caveman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well no one knows for sure. But it's suspected that because Neanderthal was a nomadic huntsman, he roamed the land, only fending for himself - never learning to cohabitate with others. So as Cro Magnon families settled into Europe, they took over the land. One by one, Neanderthal was pushed out...and never seen, or heard from again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (game show voice) That's quite a story. Thank you Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Adam look at the kids, they look bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly to Adam) You really know how to win a crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the kids) But you never know, just cause they vanished doesn't mean they're gone. For all we know, there could be a Neanderthal walking among us right now. And by the looks of this guy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points at Neanderthal) I'd say he probably plays defense for the Raiders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's joke gets a small laugh from the teacher, but zero response from the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sucks ass. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Seth look at each other in shock...Seth chimes i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see dinosaurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth runs down the hall towards the dinosaur exhibit. The kids follow in excitement. The teacher barely bats an eye she takes her time slowly trailing after the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters the hospital...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam leafs through a pamphlet on Incontinence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pedantic DR. ROSS enters and completely ignores Adam. Instead, he looks over Adam's chart, examines his MRI sca and pulls out a DICTAPHONE -

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: (into the dictaphone) Patient has been complaining of excessive urination, back pain, and night sweats. Blood tests and urine analysis are normal. MRI indicates a massive intraduaral extradural

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: neurofibrosarcomas extending into psoas muscle with nerve root compression syndrome and bone erosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Adam's face gradually look more and more confused, slowly begins to raise his arm as if to ask a question.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Growth extends from the L2 to L5. Cytotoxic antibiotics are recommended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ross turns to see Adam holding his arm in the air.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. Questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you just said. Is there something wrong with me? 18.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: (points to MRI) If you look here on your MRI, you see this cephalopod like object spreading down along your spinal column?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam squints. It all looks the same.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That is a massive schwannoma neurofibrosarcomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still have no idea what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: It's a malignant tumor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!...A tumor? No.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that possible?...I don't smoke. I don't drink. I eat healthy...I even recycle.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Well Adam it's actually quite fascinating. Your cancer is the result of an incredibly rare gene mutation in chromosome 17p in the p53 Gene that causes the growth of malignant cells in tissue around the nerves. In your case it's grown along the nerves in your lower spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in denial) But, look at me. I don't look sick.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Cancer often has no specific symptoms. People can go years with out knowing they're sick. We're lucky we caught it before it metastasizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put you on a 4 month regimen of chemotherapy. It's an aggressive dosage so you might want to think about taking some time off from work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is real. Adam walks to the window and presses his fa against the glass. He looks down at the city below. From stories up, the people on the street look like miniature figurines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns back to Dr. Ross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just cut it out of me?

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS
dialogues.text: Yes, that is an option. But because the tumor has spread to a such significant size. Cutting it out now would be risky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what are my chances of beating this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ross puts on his best act of reassurance. His words a seemingly genuine, his tone is anything but.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DR. Ross Listen, you're in good hands. The best thing for you to do right now is to not worry...Let me do the worrying. Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ross takes a long look at Adam's devastated face.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe you should talk to someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ross hands Adam a business card for the "Mount Sinai Psychology Group".

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have a whole department of psychologists here in the hospital. They specialize in cases...in these...sort of matters. They'll be able to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not knowing what else to say, Dr. Ross looks at his watch looks back to Adam, and moves to the door. 20.

dialogues.speaker: DR. ROSS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hang in there champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a computer screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Neurofibrosarcoma Schwannoma. Treatment Forms: Chemother and Radiation offer negligible success rates. Surgical resection proven to be most effective. Risks of surgery: Amputation of limbs. Paralysis. Death. 2 Year survival ra 50%. If tumor metastasizes systemically, 2 year survival rate: 0%."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits staring at the screen. This is not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIBRARIAN, a tall blond surfer type, taps Adam on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey bro, time's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled. Adam looks up at the librarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have just a few more minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry bro. Twenty minute limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The librarian motions to the LONG LINE of mostly HOMELESS CUSTOMERS waiting to use the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus stops. Adam gets off, walks to his house, and tak deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters the living room - it's empty. NPR News is on radio. Fresh paint dries on a canvas resting on an easel. sound of someone cooking comes from the kitchen. 21.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Adam? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks into the kitchen. Rachel is at the stove cooki in her underwear. Adam stands in the doorway watching her God she looks sexy. Rachel turns -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a Hungarian accent) Welcome home Mr. Adam. I made vegetarian goulash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a ballerina, Rachel crosses to Adam on her tip toes holding out a spoon of her goulash. She holds up the offe to Adam's mouth. He takes a small bite and smiles, trying hide his internal distress. His sad eyes tell Rachel anot story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still using accent) What is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still using accent) Liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not going to be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel drops the accent. This seems serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a doctor's appointment today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of doctor's appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam has no idea what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen the movie "Beaches"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean with Bette Midler? 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as good as "The Rose", but good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the end of "Beaches"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sad....What does that have to do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam just looks her in the eyes...Rachel gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In total shock, Rachel covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I do know, but I can't pronounce it. Neuroscharnoma or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well how bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel hugs Adam. Soaking in the comfort, Adam rests his on her shoulder. She gently strokes his hair. Adam's hand slowly moves down Rachel's back. He starts kissing her ne He knows it's wrong, but can't help it, the only thing running through his mind is sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a beat Rachel pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begins to cry) You have cancer. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart racing, Rachel opens the top pantry. She reaches ba as far as she can and pulls out a cookie jar. She sticks hand in the jar and pulls out an old pack of American Spirits. Adam looks at Rachel disapprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think it's an interesting time to take up smoking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam I'm 24 years old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel puts one of the cigarettes to her mouth, lights it the stove and takes a drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel begins compulsively pulling drags from the cigaret Adam takes the cigarette out of her hand. He goes to put out, but takes a drag instead. He then hugs Rachel with o hand and opens the window with the other; he proceeds to discreetly fan out the cigarette smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sshhhh. Everything's going to be alright Yammy. I'm going to start chemo in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace in total silence...A beat. And then Adam gro with the realization -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh...and my parents are coming over for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is clearly not in the mood to see his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRE LAP: The sound of a doorbell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Adam stand in front of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's mother, EDITH SCHWARTZ (55) enters. Edith is a sho portly woman with thick glasses and a bright red sweatshi bearing a cross-stitched cat on it. If the borough of Que and the city of Milwaukee had a child, it would be Edith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith gives Rachel a big hug, and grabs for her left hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to hear the big news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ART SCHWARTZ(58) enters the house carrying a CAT. Due to stroke 10 years prior, he carries a limp and is a little of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found your cat playing in the neighbors yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I don't have a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art drops the cat and it bolts out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's for dinner? 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits around the table. Edith pokes at her plate vegetarian goulash, confused as to what she's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had known you were coming I would have made something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just glad to finally be sharing a shabbat dinner with my son... (looks at her plate) So this isn't meat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's called sei-tan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's made of wheat gluten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith looks more confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's not meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it has a texture just like meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith reluctantly takes a small bite of the goulash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm. It's Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith puts her spoon down. She pulls a handful of pills o her fanny-pack and puts them in front of Art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art, take your pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art picks up the pills and puts them in his mouth, but doesn't swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Art swallows, Edith eagerly turns her attention to Rac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? Did you set a date? 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not do summer like your cousin, remember how awful that was? Schlepping around in the heat like that. Plus the bugs and the gnats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Rachel) What is she talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Rachel. I know we haven't discussed this, but are you going to convert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Adam) She thinks we're getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom. We're not getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So then what's the big news that you made us rush all the way over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not knowing how to tell his mother the upsetting news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen "Terms of Endearment"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh jesus Adam, just tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright fine. But, before I tell you, you have to promise me you're going to stay calm. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Adam, don't be so overdramatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, just promise me. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise...You make me out to be some kind of irrational loon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here goes nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath) I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer? What do you mean you have cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I have a giant tumor in my spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith sits motionless for what seems an eternity. The onl indication that she's not dead is the movement of her ind finger, which twitches uncontrollably. Adam sits uneasy, tying to anticipate his mother's next move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith calmly rises from of her seat and heads to the kitc Adam follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith lights the stove, and puts up a kettle of Tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making you green tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, will you come sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith holds up the package of Green Tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw on the Today Show that it reduces your risk of getting cancer by fifteen percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I already have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Refusing to look at her son, Edith frantically rifles thr her fanny pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here take these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her hands now shaking uncontrollably, Edith hands Adam a large number of prescription pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aspirin, Zoloft, Lexapro, Lipitor, Flagel, Ditropan, Alka Seltzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, please, stop. I don't need these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take the god-damn pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam take Edith's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith's a nervous wreck, frantic and hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could this happen? 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's genetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Genetic? It must be from your father's side of the family, they're always getting sick. Your uncle Bobby just got Crohns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's father looks up from his plate of goulash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a disorder of the bowels, son. How are your bowels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is not with my bowels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a lucky man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No. Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, I'm your mother, and I need to be close to you in your time of need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a terrible idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well who's going to take care of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I have a right to take care of my son with cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing. Really. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! You tell me you have cancer of the spine and now you tell me it's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks to Rachel for support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith, I can't even imagine how hard this must be for you. But I promise, there's nothing for you to worry about. I'm going to be here every step of the way, to help take good care of your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a very lucky boy to be with such a good girl. You know that? You don't deserve her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks at Rachel and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Seth stand on an endless line of BUSINESS MEN an WOMEN waiting for their morning coffee. Greg is at the fr of that line - he's taking forever to decide what he want Adam impatiently looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking him so long? How hard is it to buy a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth ignores Adam as he stares at the cleavage on the WOM behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Adam) Look at how tight that shirt is. She's totally aware of how large her breasts look too. This morning when she got dressed, she said to herself - "I have these things and I want the world to see them."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks up at the menu of endless options. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that frozen drink, what's that like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bavarian Blender. It's absolute heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Does it have a lot of sugar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been here 20 minutes. What's he shopping for a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth's eyes are still fixed on the woman's breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you in such a rush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks around at all the stodgy business men all havi menial conversations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really how you want to spend the rest of your life? Wasting away in this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg still hasn't made up his mind. Adam snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. Why can't he just get a latte like he does every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. We have plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we don't have plenty of time! Life is finite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah right. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here. You have cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People in line look at Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a little louder, you can make a special announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday. They found a tumor in my spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who found the tumor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lewis and Clark...The doctors found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When were you going to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had cancer I'd tell you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want the Better Friend award? It's not an easy topic to bring up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth takes a deep breath. A look of panic sweeps across h face...he quickly shakes it off. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's relax here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the best thing to do is to look on the bright side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bright side of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your chance to do all the things you've always wanted. This is it. This is your time to live it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, do you know how much pussy we're going to get?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel pulls her car up to the front of the hospital. Ada kisses her goodbye and gets out of the car. He takes a fe steps and then turns back. He gives her a nervous smile a then continues into the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam walks down the hospital corridor passing dozens of patients, none of whom are under the age of 40. In Adam's hand is the business card with "Mount Sinai Psychology Gr written on it. He finds the office and knocks on the half opened door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is small, cold and emotionless - with stacks o psychology books and files strewn about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An attractive young woman, KATIE (26), sits behind a desk reading a file while she eats a rather messy sandwich. Ka takes her job very seriously, but has not quite mastered art of speaking without sounding like a rigid grad studen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate looks up as she takes a bite of her sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full of food) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an appointment with Dr. McRae. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie puts down the sandwich, rises from her seat and put her hand out to shake Adam's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please call me Katie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Dr. McRae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were expecting someone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie wraps up her sandwich and puts the rest away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you supposed to be like sixty-five and wear earth toned sweaters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Did someone say that's what I look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. I was just expecting someone older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No believe me, you're fine. Better than fine, you're Dr. McRae...you're a doctor? How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-six? What are you like Doogie Howser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doogie Howser...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Katie's blank look. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The teenage doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Nevermind...but aren't you young to be a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually in my final semester of medical school. (off Adam's look) This is a training hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have you had many patients?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're actually my first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That did not help to ease Adam's anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam notices a dark stain on the couch. He sits as far fr it as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie pulls out Adam's file and sits in a chair across fr him. Adam looks anxious, this is his first time in therap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Ross filled me in on your situation. Tell me, how have you been feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly. I feel fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's great considering what you're going through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I tend to internalize everything so, who knows. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you repress as a coping mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I say it sounds cute in a neurotic way. When you say it, it's like an indictment. The word "repress" - sounds so harsh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's actually quite common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh good, I'd hate to think I'm anything but an emotional sheep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think of it in those terms. It's not like it's been a conscious decision on your part. What's important now is for you to be aware of the way you treat your emotions and for me to help you make adjustments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do we do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing I want you to do is to stop looking at cancer as a burden. Cancer has come into your life to show you that your emotional and physical bodies are out of balance. This is your chance to correct that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not in a cult are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it was a bad joke. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's a reason. You chose to use humor rather than express how you really feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie is losing Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In order to heal the body, you must heal the mind. It's imperative that you free yourself from stress and anger. Get rid of all those negative emotions stored deep inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's mind drifts away from Katie. He focuses on all the clutter. The slanted clock. The wilting plant. The crumbl paper on the floor. The mess is driving him crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So today what I want to do is start you on some very simple relaxation therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie presses play on her iPod. We hear the soothing soun of new agey flute music. Adam looks up in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to lay back and close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks down at the coffee stained couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I want you to just lay back, and let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we be analyzing my childhood? Or my days as a call girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another joke? 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on. Nothing? That was funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssshhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katie stands behind Adam and places her hands on his shoulders. Despite the fact that this is all too strange, doesn't mind, in a weird way, Adam is enjoying the attent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finally lies down, contorting his body so as to avoid stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes and relax. Find a place inside yourself where you can escape the cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes closed. No peeking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is seated at the dining table with his eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you got me a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that Prada handbag I've been eyeing?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Keep your eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about surprises. Last surprise I got my parents told me I was adopted. 39.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You're not adopted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but sometimes I wish I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel crosses into the room and stands over Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Open your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam opens his eyes to see Rachel holding a tiny SHIH-TZU wearing a pink ribbon in it's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stares in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Noodle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so small. What do you do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, IT's a he, and HE's adorable...Having a dog is supposed to help with the healing process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, did it go to medical school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd be happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks like a gremlin. What happens if you get it wet after midnight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel looks furious. Adam backtracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can barely take care of myself, I don't think I can handle another living, breathing, needy, thing in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't realize it would be such a big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can bring him back to the shelter in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're right, it's not a good idea. Tomorrow I'll take him back where he'll be kept in a tiny cage with 10 other dogs who will bully him, and rape him, and then he'll eventually be euthanized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog looks at Adam. It's hopeless, there's no way Adam going to win this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. Fine, we can keep the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel's face lights up. She hugs Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be so good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam turns to see the dog shitting on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sets over the San Diego skyline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Adam's going away party. Draped across the entrance "Bon Voyage" banner with an image of a Cruise Ship. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Rachel and Seth enter to find a crowd of mostly unfamiliar faces. Phil, who has had one too many vodka tonics, approaches Adam - drink in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is, the man of the hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil takes a sip from his glass, and then offers it to Ad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil puts his arm around Adam and gestures wildly - causi his drink to splash on Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cancer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. The Big C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil tugs on Adam's hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you wearing a wig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, this is my real hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna miss you so much buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil puts his head on Adam's shoulder. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for a moment, I think I see someone over there from a previous life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is talking with his co-worker JOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you started chemo yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it man. It'll fuck you up. That's like some Nagasaki shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands with SUSAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to know the secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat nothing but green foods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a specific kind of green food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, any green food. It works, my sister's friend survived lung cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands with TED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what kind of cancer do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schwannoma Neurofibrosarcomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never heard of it. 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty rare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, you don't look sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancer often has no specific symptoms. People can go years with out knowing they're sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam with Susan again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's spinach, zucchini, broccoli, kale, cucumbers, green beans, snow peas, seaweed, kiwi, Zucchini,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you already said zucchini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zucchini...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the room, Adam and Rachel lock eyes. He gives a defeated look, as if to say "help me." Rachel gives a sympathetic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you paying attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught off guard) Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I'm only trying to help save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the room, Rachel laughs at the entire episode Adam sparks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is talking with EDDIE. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's this guy on the beach who injects oxygen into your blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that legal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it's totally safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam with Susan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Brussel Sprouts, Turnip greens, Asparagus, Celery, Cabbage, Okra, Honeydew Melon, Limes, Green bell peppers, green chiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny cries hysterically as Seth consoles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that he has cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen him every day for the past two years and I've never once made an effort to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm his best friend, so talking to me in a way is kind of like talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh what does it matter? It's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny walks away crying. Seth follows after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. It's not too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam makes himself a drink at the bar. Greg approaches. 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (less than excited) Hey Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle had what you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man that was the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle had Schwannoma Neurofibrosarcomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so. It's the thing with the toe and the screaming, and everything tastes like olives? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel and Adam drive home from the party. They're in completely different moods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that was a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, those people just threw you a party...They love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half those people don't even know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops at a red light. Rachel looks at Adam. She f his pouting adorable. He sees her staring,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel takes Adam's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look intensely into each others eyes and then kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Rachel make-out as they enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make their way into the bedroom and clumsily undress another. Adam looks at Rachel's naked body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so unbelievably sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm totally yours,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a loud scratching at the bedroom door, followed by a loud whimpering. Rachel stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noodle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam continues to kiss Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore him. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he needs to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two continue making out. The dog starts to bark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this with him barking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands on the sidewalk impatiently waiting for the d to do his business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Come on. Today...If I don't get laid tonight because of you, I'm going to take your little bow and make a noose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog sniffs around, trying to find the perfect spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! I need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADAM'S NEIGHBOR walks by with A GIANT MASTIFF. He sees Ad yelling at the little Shi Tzu in ribbons. Adam looks up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the neighbor is out of sight-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please just finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog finally finishes. Adam runs back into the house. After a minute, he realizes he left the dog in the street runs back after the dog, scoops him up and then runs back inside. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam fumbles around in the dark as he tears off his cloth He then climbs back into bed, spoons Rachel, and begins seductively kissing her neck. He slowly moves his hand downwards. Rachel takes Adam's hand, pulls it up, and cla it tight against her chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two lay silently with Adam's arms wrapped around Rach body. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you...want to move in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want me to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking it might be nice, now that I'm not going to work anymore. And with my chemo starting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel turns to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here all the time anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel kisses Adam and lays her head on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna have sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the morning. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith's car whizzes down the street and peels into the Be Israel Synagogue parking lot. The car comes to an abrupt as it parks in the last empty space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith and Adam step out of the car and walk 20 feet befor they realize Art is still in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art, still in the car, doesn't move. Edith looks at her w and walks back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith grabs Art's hand. He slowly gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith, Art and Adam enter into the 600 seat synagogue. Th service led by RABBI JACOBS (75) has already begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith spots three empty seats all the way in the left cor of the first row. Prime seats, but a bitch to get to sinc the service has begun - getting there would mean wading through a row of two dozen people. The USHER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take your seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Usher motions for Edith and company to sit in the bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those seats up there in the front?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service has begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. My son has cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's jaw tightens, he can't believe his mother just did that. The Usher looks at Adam, sizing up the situation. A couldn't be more uncomfortable. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usher leads the group to the front and directs the pe in the front row to let them pass through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith apologizes as each person they pass has to stand to them by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, my son has cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam smiles in embarrassment as he steps past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith and Art stand in a crowd of 600 congregants sociali and conversing after the service. ROSE (60) approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Rose. Things are not well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard about the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you how hard it's been on me. My only child. God only knows what terrible thing I did to deserve this. I've got a catatonic husband and a son with cancer. Not to mention my arthritis. I don't know how I'll ever get through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Adam walks through the atrium, he notices everyone whispering and pointing at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbi Jacobs (75) exits the bathroom, pulls up his fly an spots Adam. Jacobs has the face of a leather couch from a the tanning and face lifts. He spots Adam. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentleman, Adam Schwartz!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rabbi Jacobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you know, just trying to live by the Covenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me. You were the worst student I ever had. I bet you haven't even spoken a word of Hebrew since your Bar Mitzvah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like to brag, but I couldn't speak it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mother told me about your situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam looks over to see his mother surrounded by a dozen sympathetic listeners as she tells them her horror story having a son with cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not easy for a mother to see her son go through something like this,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing is easy for my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about trying to reconnect with the Torah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I'm just here to make my mother happy. It was either this or I had to go see my cousin perform in his high school theatre's adaptation of "You've Got Mail". 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well think about it. I'm always here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALAN ALDA looks directly into the camera. The year is 197

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, I'm Alan Alda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan Alda walks down the hospital corridor.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you've been told you have cancer. Well, you're not alone. 1 in every 3 people living today will experience some form of the disease...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of people walking in Times Square, arrows slowly p up over the heads of every third person.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You may be wondering what is cancer? Well, cancer is a group of more than 100 different diseases characterized by the abnormal growth of cells. These cells form a lump or mass called a "tumor".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reddish freckle dissolves into massive tumor.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Cancer is treated through the use of a revolutionizing medicine called Che-mo-therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of a very PRETTY WOMAN being administered a small pi by a Nurse. The woman smiles politely to the Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chemotherapy is a very serious treatment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of a Doctor speaking intently to the Pretty Woman wh listens closely.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It works by destroying cancer cells; unfortunately, it cannot tell the difference between cancer cells and healthy cells. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of a poorly designed diagram of the human body. A mi substance runs through the body destroying all the variou cells in it's path.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As a result, it's going to make you feel tired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Image of yawning kitten.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of a School Nurse checking a child's temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music begins to ramp.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...You are about to embark on the journey of a lifetime. So aim high...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shot of APOLLO 11 lifting off.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...and always remember, the road to recovery is a team effort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of a girls volleyball team. One of the players ser up a pass and another spikes it down. All the girls high- five.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's important that you talk openly with your health care providers. Ask questions so you can know all the facts. Being prepared is half the battle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on Alan Alda.

dialogues.speaker: ALAN ALDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toward helping yourself begin to feel in control again...On behalf of all the great folks at Mount Sinai Hospital, I'd like to thank you for your time...make it a great day. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of patients, including Adam, have been watc the video. The people in the room applaud, Adam looks aro baffled by both the video and the clapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE, a tall male nurse of Bahamian descent, enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam Schwartz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam follows George into the elevator where they ride dow into the bowel of the hospital: The Cancer Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking through the long ominous halls of the hospital basement, Adam passes dozens of sick patients who are bei shuttled into Radiation Therapy, Chemotherapy and other various treatment rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sick, fat, BALD ELDERLY WOMAN coughs as she passes. Ada winces in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way my baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George leads Adam into a Chemotherapy Treatment room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is seated in a plush leather chair where he's hooked into a chemo drip. He's surrounded by a dozen gaunt, hair patients. He is the youngest patient by at least 20 years Completely overwhelmed, Adam spots A BALD WOMAN sitting quietly knitting. She's at peace with herself. Her Zen li state helps Adam relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
